elements.title: Hayari Miyake (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Japanese surgeon Hayari Miyake (pictured) cured Albert Einstein of a tropical fever?

elements.title: Symphony for Strings (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that after 1943, the Symphony for Strings by Georgy Sviridov was not played again until 2000?

elements.title: the local branch of the Nazi Party (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that non-white Samoan people were permitted to join the local branch of the Nazi Party in the 1930s?

elements.title: a Philadelphia TV station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that a Philadelphia TV station shut down because of a family feud?

elements.title: Ecco2K (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Ecco2K created a fashion brand when he was 16 years old by talking online to Chinese factory managers who did not know his age?

elements.title: an 1814 British raid on a fort in Virginia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that an 1814 British raid on a fort in Virginia was guided by an escaped slave of the American garrison commander?

elements.title: Mercer Art Gallery (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Mercer Art Gallery rediscovered little-known artist Eva Leigh and exhibited her work?

elements.title: Carl Ludvig Lithander (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that classical composer Carl Ludvig Lithander also worked as a teacher at a military academy?

elements.title: a day to celebrate North Koreans (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that South Korea has a day to celebrate North Koreans?
